heading: 1 Prerequisites
text:
highly recommended following R packages installed 
computers starting course.packages can installed CRAN Github Bioconductor:Remember Rmd file contains one one chapter, chapter defined first-level heading #.compile example PDF, need XeLaTeX. recommended install TinyTeX (includes XeLaTeX): https://yihui.name/tinytex/.

heading: 2 Introduction
text:
can label chapter section titles using {#label} , e.g., can reference Chapter 2. manually label , automatic labels anyway, e.g., Chapter ??.Figures tables captions placed figure table environments, respectively.
Figure 2.1: nice figure!
Reference figure code chunk label fig: prefix, e.g., see Figure 2.1. Similarly, can reference tables generated knitr::kable(), e.g., see Table 2.1.Table 2.1: nice table!can write citations, . example, using bookdown package (Xie 2024) sample book, built top R Markdown knitr (Xie 2015).
code:
par(mar = c(4, 4, .1, .1))
plot(pressure, type = 'b', pch = 19)
knitr::kable(
  head(iris, 20), caption = 'Here is a nice table!',
  booktabs = TRUE
)

heading: 3.1 Variables
text:
Variables containers storing data values. resuable.can see variable myvar stores value 5 later gets replaced
Hello, World!
code:
myvar <- 5
print(myvar)## [1] 5
myvar <- "Hello, World!"
print(myvar)## [1] "Hello, World!"

heading: 3.2 R-objects
text:
Although can make vectors manually using c() function, also
specialised functions making vectors.seq() function can used make arithmetic series values.rep() function simply repeats value specified number times.special operator : creating vectors sequential integers

heading: 3.2.1 Accessing Vector Subsets
text: One can access specific positions vector various ways

heading: 3.2.2 Named Vectors
text:
R data structures option assigning names numeric positions can use 
name access data instead position.
code:
myobj <- 11:15
names(myobj) <- c("pos1","pos2","pos3","pos4","pos5")
myobj## pos1 pos2 pos3 pos4 pos5 
##   11   12   13   14   15
myobj[c("pos2","pos5","pos1")]## pos2 pos5 pos1 
##   12   15   11

heading: 4 Day 1 Practice
text: describe methods chapter.Math can added body using usual syntax like

heading: 4.1 math example
text:
\(p\) unknown expected around 1/3. Standard error approximated\[
SE = \sqrt(\frac{p(1-p)}{n}) \approx \sqrt{\frac{1/3 (1 - 1/3)} {300}} = 0.027
\]can also use math footnotes like this1.approximate standard error 0.0272
